text: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, primarily focused on single-page applications where data changes over time.
The core building block of any React application is the Component. Components are independent and reusable pieces of UI, often categorized as functional or class-based.
Quiz: What does JSX stand for? A) JavaScript XML B) JavaScript Extension C) JSON XML D) Java Syntax Extension
Exercise: Create a simple functional component that uses the useState hook to manage a counter value, incrementing it with a button click. Focus on proper state updates.
The Virtual DOM is a programming concept where a virtual representation of a UI is kept in memory and synced with the 'real' DOM. React uses this for performance optimization.
Official Documentation: The best place to start and reference is the official React documentation (react.dev). It provides up-to-date information on Hooks and concurrent rendering.
Using React Hooks (like useEffect and useState) allows developers to use state and other React features without writing a class component. This is the modern standard.
